The distortions were made from the optimized initial geometry. From the potential energy surfaces of the silol e can be highlight ed the presence of a first excited state with great distortion tendencies, it has little energy variation even suffering a great distortion in its equilibrium geometry. Also the possibility of crossing with the ground state in the form 1E (4E) for very distorted molecules . ùëÜ2 ‚àíùëÜ3 intersections are also observed for surfaces in the 0E and 1E forms at amplitudes above 25 ¬∞ involving ùúé‚àí ùúã‚àó transitions, differing from the other molecules in the series.
